main.loading:
Thank you for your patience
as we fulfill your request.

projectInfo.ProjectInfoTitleInfo:
To receive access to the BC Services Card login API to use with your web application, we need to gather some information about the application you’re working with.

Collecting this information allows us to understand the purpose of your application or project within your organization and provide proper assistance to you as you move through from development to the live access request.
projectInfo.ProjectOrgTitle: This API is available for organizations that fall within the BC Broader Public Sector (BPS).
projectInfo.RolesTitleInfo: In this system, a project consists of one (or more) Developer(s), a Manager and an Executive sponsor. Please provide contact information for each of these roles within your organization in the context of this project.
projectInfo.myRole: My role in this project is:
projectInfo.OrganizationNameHint: BC Services Card login is available to many Public Sector agencies. Please let us know which one you are affiliated with.
projectInfo.projectNameHint: Please provide us with a short name of your application which will create a login option with the BC Services Card
projectInfo.DescriptionHint: Please provide us with a short description of your application and why you need the BC Services Card as a login method
projectInfo.developerHint: Please provide developer’s contact information who is associated to this request and project. This is a person who understand OIDC and will be able to configure your BPS application for the BC Services Card Login
projectInfo.managerHint: Please provide managers contact information who is associated to this request and project. This is a person who will be the main point of contact for the BC Services Card IDIM team and provide updates on the project’s privacy, security, communication and agreement progress.
projectInfo.ctoHint: Please provide Executive Sponsor’s contact information who is associated to this request and project. This is a person who will provide attestations to the BC Services Card IDIM team on the compliance and completion of privacy, security, communication and agreement items.

technicalRequirements.technicalTitleInfo: The authentication process with BC Services Card is through Open ID Connect (OIDC). The following parameters are required for us to initiate the connection.
technicalRequirements.inputAppText: Add the URL of your application home page, or where users will go to understand what your application does.
technicalRequirements.inputUrlText: Input the URL(s) of your redirect location(s). These are potential URL addresses to which we could redirect your application on successful user authentication. If you have multiple redirects, use one field for each URL.
technicalRequirements.JWKSText: Input the URL to your JSON Web Key Set (JWKS). The BC Services Card implementation of OIDC requires you to implement a URL from which your JWKS can be obtained. You also need to tell us which cryptographic algorithms we should use for ID tokens and user information signed responses. (default is RS256).
technicalRequirements.labelEncryptedResponseAlgHint: This is the algorithm you would like us to use for encrypting the returned JWT.
technicalRequirements.labelSignedResponseAlgHint: This is the algorithm you would like us to use for signing the returned JWT. We sign with our private key, our public key is included in the token.

selectPackage.pagetitleInfo:
OIDC scopes are collections of user attributes which can be returned on successful authentication.

Select the most appropriate package of scopes for your use case, noting that the more attributes you require, the greater the overhead of complying with privacy regulations.


The following standard scopes are supported :

  • openid - Unique identifier
  • profile - Given name and surname
  • email - Email address
  • address - Physical address (Street, locality, state or province, postal code and country)
selectPackage.description: This package contains the following data:
selectPackage.package1: Package 1 - best fit for organizations looking for a digital signature
selectPackage.package2: Package 2 - best fit for organizations who want to know who the user is and communicate directly with their users electronically
selectPackage.package3: Package 3 - best fit for organizations who want to know who the user is and communicate directly with their users non-electronically
selectPackage.how_many_test_account: How many test accounts do you require?
selectPackage.special_notes: Special requests or notes for test account creation

testAccount.pageinfo: In order to test your configuration, we would like to know how many test accounts you need for {package}. Please note the test data provided to you will be randomized unless you indicate you have preferred customization. If you select the randomized test account, you can expect the test accounts immediately or within X days.
testAccount.how_many_test_account: Choose the number of test user accounts you require
testAccount.specialNotesInfo:
If you have any special requests regarding the data contained in these test accounts, please include that information in this space.

(For example: all users must have a different city in the address block)

summaryPage.subTitle:
The details you entered are shown as a summary on this page. Please review the information to ensure that it is correct before submitting your request with the “Submit Request” button.


If you need to make changes at this stage, you can edit the sections using the edit icons on this page.

summaryPage.cantSubmitErrorMessage: Your submission contains incomplete fields. Please edit any sections requiring completion before submitting your request.
summaryPage.systemError: Something went wrong while processing your request. Please retry in a few minutes. If the problem persists, please contact the Product Owner.
summaryPage.OrganizationNameHint: This is the name of the Public Sector agency with which you are affiliated.
summaryPage.projectNameHint: Please provide us with a short name of your application which will create a login option with the BC Services Card
summaryPage.developerHint: This is a person who understand OIDC and will be able to configure your BPS application for the BC Services Card Login
summaryPage.managerHint: This is a person who will be the main point of contact for the BC Services Card IDIM team and provide updates on the project’s privacy, security, communication and agreement progress.
summaryPage.ctoHint: This is a person who will provide attestations to the BC Services Card IDIM team on the compliance and completion of privacy, security, communication and agreement items.
summaryPage.applicationUrlHint: This is your application home page, or where users will go to use your application.
summaryPage.labelRedirectUrlHint: These are potential URL addresses to which we could redirect your application on successful user authentication. If you have multiple redirects, use one field for each URL.
summaryPage.labelJWKSUrlHint: We use your JWKS  public key to encrypt our returned JWT. Warning - If the JWKS does not resolve, the JWT will not be encrypted.
summaryPage.labelEncryptedResponseAlgHint: This is the algorithm you would like us to use for encrypting the returned JWT.
summaryPage.labelSignedResponseAlgHint: This is the algorithm you would like us to use for signing the returned JWT. We sign with our private key, our public key is included in the token.
summaryPage.labelDataPackageReqdHint: Package of OIDC scopes (or user attributes) made available to your application on successful login

ClientID.titleApiKeyInfo: This is a unique identifier for your project. Any request to access the BC Services Card system must have this to identify your application.
ClientID.titleClientSecretInfo: This is a secret or password which is to be used together with the Client ID to obtain a token from the BC Services Card system for ongoing authorization.
ClientID.titleTestAccountInfo:
These are account numbers with associated passphrases which can be used as test logins to the BC Services Card.The test accounts are provided in the format of ID #, ID key

Learn more

dashboard.noData: There are no projects to view. Add one to start

profile.titlePageInfo: After you add your contact information, you will receive a confirmation email. Only users from the broader public sector or BC Government will be approved for access.
profile.errorMessageDomain: Your email address does not match any of the eligible organizations in our BC Services Card Self Service System. If you believe you or your organization should have access to this system, please contact IDIM Consulting to be added.

home.txtMainTitle: Easily implement BC Services Card for online authentication
home.txtFitForOrganization: Is this a fit for your organization?
home.txtsubcontent1: Do you want to use digital technologies that are transforming the way British Columbians live, work and play?
home.txtsubcontent2: Are you part of a Broader Public Sector organization?
home.txtsubcontent3: Is your organization in need of high assurance authentication?
home.txtsubcontent4: Broader Public Sector includes the core provincial public service (ministries), health authorities, Crown corporations, K-12 schools, colleges, institutes, teaching universities, and research universities, contracted social service providers. It does not include Federal, local and municipal governments.

testAccountList.pageinfo: Some text for add test account
testAccountList.special_notes: Past your test accounts without heading
